Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
BC
An {arbitrary precision} numeric processing language with {C}-like {syntax}. Traditionally implemented as a front-end to {DC}. There is a {GNU} version called {GNU BC}.
{Unix manual page}: bc(1).

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: BC \BC\, B C \B. C.\n. before Christ; used in reckoning dates before the supposed year Christ was born, i.e. 1 a. d.. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: BC \BC\, B C \B. C.\n. before Christ; used in reckoning dates before the supposed year Christ was born, i.e. 1 a. d.. [WordNet 1.5]
B.C. adv : before the Christian era; used following dates before the supposed year Christ was born; "in 200 BC" [syn: {BC}, {before Christ}]
BC adv : before the Christian era; used following dates before the supposed year Christ was born; "in 200 BC" [syn: {B.C.}, {before Christ}]
